page.title: 04NURSERY FARM
page.content: {Nursery Farm,}owned by Mrs.Renton. The earliest record of the house is 1590 when it was called {Fullers, later {Salters Folly.}It stands in 1 acre of land, originally 20 acres. Until 19th century it was surrounded by Common Land, now farmland.The house is listed because of unusual murals painted on the staircase panelling. They are of little angels;in Victorian times they were covered by curtains, ladies should not look.In a bedroom is a painting of The Fire of London,this was painted in about 1666.In 1774 insurance against fire was given to the owner,William Sheperd.The plaque with the number 343908 can still be seen.The house is still being investigated by the Essex County Council Archives.
